description: This is the hilarious moment a clumsy Scottish woman tried to prank her boyfriend (pictured) with flour - but ends up accidentally smacking him on the head with a frying pan, much to his confusion.
title: Moment a woman accidentally smacks her boyfriend on head
title_page: Moment a woman accidentally smacks her boyfriend on head | Daily Mail Online
text:
Hilarious footage has captured the moment a clumsy Scot accidentally hit her boyfriend over the head with a pan - whilst trying to pour flour on him as a prank.
In the video, the woman whacks the man with the metal pan as he gets out of the shower, producing a loud pinging sound.
At the start of the footage, the woman can be seen in her hallway preparing a pan full of flour.
She then walks into the bathroom, and waits behind the door, before moving out and flinging the flour towards the man, who is drying himself with a towel.
She flings the pan, and a pinging noise is heard as it connects with the man's head.
The camera then pans towards the man, who is covered in flour and holding his head - and he says: 'What the f*** are you doing?'
Leaving the bathroom in shock, the woman begins laughing too much to apologise.
As the video starts out it appears that the woman is trying to take part in a flour prank
The video was posted on the Scottish Memes and Banter Facebook page this on Thursday, and has been viewed thousands of times already.
It was uploaded with the caption: 'Pranking her man and 'accidentaly' smacks him in the head with the pot.'
Viewers have been expressing their delight with the video.
Cathy Turner said: 'Oh my god I think I've p***** myself.'
But it goes badly wrong, and the woman ends up using the wrong side of the frying pan to hit her boyfriend on the head
Shelley Adam added: 'I'm laughing so bad what was she trying to do?'
Elise Combe wrote: 'I'd end up doing that', followed by several laughing emojis.
Ryan Welsh quipped: 'RIP hen!'
